description: From Middle English specifien, from Old French specifier, especefier, or directly from Medieval Latin specificō, from specificus (“specific”).

verbs.description: specify (third-person singular simple present specifies, present participle specifying, simple past and past participle specified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To state explicitly, or in detail, or as a condition.
(transitive) To bring about a specific result.
(intransitive, obsolete) To speak explicitly or in detail (often used with of).
